item.title: I hate you, Twitter.
item.description:
Seeing as how Posterous was bought out by twitter and is shutting down in a month, it's time to move!

After some shenanigans (read: contacting a total stranger through a blog that had been deserted for 10 years) I have acquired http://chasethewind.wordpress.com/ and it is now up and running!

You can go there now for a new update! =)

(that is a lie, I am sorry there is no new update D=)

Goodbye Posterous, you've been good to me =(

item.title: New New Beginnings!
item.description:
So I could make a glorious comeback onto the blog with amazing pictures and stories of what exactly I was doing while neglecting it...

 

OR I COULD SHOW YOU HOW TO MAKE CAKE.

If you don't prefer the cake, there is a slight chance that this is not the blog for you.

 

MUGCAKE

The best things in this world come in a mug, and now cake is no exception.

This one's gotta be easy to remember because when it's midnight and you want chocolate cake, are you gonna come here and look up a recipe?

Eff no.

So here's what you need to remember: 5, 4, 3, 3, 2, 1, 1 and a couple other stuff.

(Wow I thought that was so clever when I thought of it but maybe that was not the case >.>)

So start with:

5 tablespoons of sugar

4 tablespoons of flour

(skip the 3s cuz they're not powder)

2 tablespoons of cocoa powder,

and 1 teaspoon of baking powder

Now let's pause here for a sec for some serious talk. I know that here we're not always super concerned about measuring, and just kind of going with the flow and just knowing everything will probably taste good anyway.

That being said,

Measure out your fucking baking powder.

Just do it, okay?

Mix all those powders together in a mug, and add a pinch of salt (this is one part of the "other stuff" ;D)

Now all we have left is the 3's and the 1.

Mix in 3 tablespoons butter/oil

3 tablespoons milk

and 1 egg.

Yiiisssssssssssssss so amazing.

(Part 2 of the "other stuff" was vanilla. So go ahead and add a few drops.)

Alright now mix all that nonsense together and do your happy dance.

Pour half of it into another mug and keep happy dancing.

Microwave them for 5 mins.

Haaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaappy dance =D

Microwaves are all different so maybe it'll take more/less time than 5 mins. Just pull it out and check on it if you want.

Once it comes out, if you want it to be pretty, put some powedered sugar on top.

It's midnight, your hair is a mess, and you're wearing a giant Tshirt and sweatpants, but you are still a classy lady, damnit.

Step 6) DEVOUR.

(^ARBITRARY NUMBER??)

Alright hopefully soon I will do real things here.

Gnight Folks =D

-edit-

hahahah I don't even know how I wrote this whole post without making this connection, but:

this is in honor of my friend Josh Cake who just started up his youtube channel and is hilarious.

Permalink | Leave a comment  »

item.title: I AM SO SORRY ;_;
item.description:
I fell off the face of the Earth there for a second =(

BUT NOW I'M BACK!

I guess I will try and catch up, but I don't see how this is possible... -___-

BUT most important thing first:

Parisian Cathedral 40 Day Lenten Challenge Double Combo! ! !

item.title: QUICK RECAP!!
item.description:
SO HERE ARE SOME THINGS THAT HAVE BEEN HAPPENING:

- THIS SUPER SWEET CHINESE GIRL came back from exploring Paris or something and because she has eaten a couple of the cookies that I have made, she brought me some pastries!

They're little cheesecake-like things and they're amazing! One of them even has a PISTACHIO CRUST at the bottom and it is DESTROYING ME (in all the right ways ;] )

What a sweetheart!

- So as you know (probably), in europe they write the date day-month-year, because that actually makes sense!

Unfortunately, though, that means martch 14th is not pi day in Europe.

BUT WHO CARES I MADE A PIE ANYWAY (SORT OF)

See the full gallery on Posterous
It was pear, and it was delicious. (Yes, it is already gone)

Pie crust recipe coming soon, at the request of a reader! ;D

-It's raining! TIME FOR TEA AND HOT CHOCOLATE

-I watched Hitcock's The Birds!

This reviewer's thoughts: WTF? WTF times a million! WTFWTFWTFWTFWTF

 

I'll be back tomorrow of pictures of some awesome church in Paris!

Gnight Folks!

(Exclamation marks!)

item.title: Moar Dessert, PC40LC Part IV
item.description:
So fundraising. I messed up. Here are the things to led to my destruction:

1) I thought it would be a good idea to sell cookies and chocolate covered strawberries to strangers.

FACT: People don't like it when you come up to them and offer them food, even if it's free (I started giving samples; NOT ONE PERSON TOOK ONE)

2) Looking at pretty things is free, why would you need to buy it?

FACT:

3) I started my new venture on way too big a scale. 

FACT: If you're gonna try selling cookies to strangers, don't start by baking 100

4) Baking skill is irrelevant with a broken oven.

FACT: I made 100 cookies. I burnt 40

 

In the end, I sold 1 cookie.

But I also made a friend, and that's priceless =]

(Still seriously that pretty much went as bad as it could have gone)

 

PC40LC IV!

Saint Sulpice

Outside:

See the full gallery on Posterous

Alter Front and Back:

See the full gallery on Posterous
The organ (so hard to take a picture of!)

and the organ player's spot

See the full gallery on Posterous

Chandelier >:D

Jesus, that cross does not look that big :/

 

Shrine of the Immaculate Conception =D

See the full gallery on Posterous

GOOD. NIGHT. FOLKS.

 

-edit-

If anybody every wondered why I NEED to get into this Ph.D program

item.title: Today's Rating: BATSHIT CRAZY
item.description:
Things started out normal today, but gradually got more and more insane. Let's take a look:

-Strained yogurt.
Standard!

-Yoga class.
A new girl joined us today and afterward she LEGITIMATELY complimented me on knowing what I'm doing (or at least making it look like I do) and that she doesn't see any difference between the class she's paying for and ours, and that like the other class, doing yoga with us alleviates some of the pain in her knees!! =D I DIED.

-Free Brunch: Lebanese!
Twas delicious. One of the super talented pianists who played at the concert two days ago was there and came to talk to us. Because this *particular* performer was super talented and REALLY FRIGGIN CUTE, I had to prep myself so that I seemed like a normal person when I introduced myself, instead of showing the panic attack I was having inside. I hope we meet again :3

-First Sunday of the Month: Musee du Luxembourg!
While this actually turned out not to be free (D:<) the exhibit on Marc Chagall was PHENOMENAL.

See the full gallery on Posterous

-A walk around the park and then SUDDENLY THIS

Check the gold pants, yo!

-A visit to the Mosque de Paris


Accompanied by a visit to the Mosque's teahouse! This place is SO GREAT. Affordable, delicious, and an amazing atmosphere. I make this promise: for anyone who visits me, I will bring you here for a lovely afternoon of Moroccan tea and a few pastries =)

Also here is where my camera died =(

-Adventure to the Sacre Coeur

I will upload pictures of the Sacre Coeur once PrC sends them to me, as I used his camera to take them xD

Also: apparently you are not supposed to take pictures inside. WHOOPS.

Also x2: I did not think ahead far enough to realize that my promise to visit a museum on the first Sunday of each month and a different church on every Sunday of Lent would overlap. This was stupid.

Also x3: I got intimidated into buying a bracelet in front of the church =( HF WARNED me about this but I forgot. =( Luckily I got away only paying a euro, but it still made me feel kind of crappy.

-Impromptu Adventures: The Moulin Rouge

Sooooo many sex shops. Pics of me and the windmill coming!

-David is Dumb: Tram Edition

Long story short, I took the wrong tram home, which gave me an extra half hour of being cold and hungry and feeling crappy (still lingering from the bracelet)

-THE TWIST

 After paradoxically feeling crappy after an awesome day, the twist came with an email from a stranger saying I could have the url chasethewind.wordpress.com!!!! I never expected to hear from this person but then BAM THERE IT WAS.

Why is this important? As it seems, posterous sold out (TO TWITTER) and is closing at the end of April. Chase the Wind is moving to Wordpress! I'll see you there soon! =) 

 

Good night, Folks =)

Permalink | Leave a comment  »

item.title: Public Expression
item.description:
Everything about this city fascinates me.

But one part especially stands out as a representation of the spirit of Paris. 

(and no, it's not the lampposts)

The graffiti.

Some of it must have taken a lot of time

Some are just a quick scribble

Some of it shows how open minded the people here are

or just the opposite

I'll be choosing carefully which ones to put here, but know that it's on every street corner

and on every tram

Gnight, folks =) <3

Permalink | Leave a comment  »

item.title: Suop
item.description:
"David, what's your favorite food?"

"Soup" 

"uh...you mean just like all soups, or one soup specifically, or...?"

"I like soup"

"So what if I asked you what your favorite soup is?"

"Soup"

"Are you just going to keep-"

"SOUP."

 

SOUP

AIGHT CLASSY LADIES. Today you're making the frenchiest soup you've ever eaten, and you don't want to embarass yourself in front of the entire city of Paris, so DON'T MESS UP

(spoiler alert: you mess up)

1) WHOA. Looks like you have some garlic, oil, onion, thyme, stock, cream, chili (if you like it hot, bow chicka bow wow ;D), and approximately one (1) fuckton of potatoes.

(read: 2 lbs or about 5 medium ones)

2) I bet you saw "garlic" and were like: okay that's cool, I got a couple of cloves of garlic.

WRONG.

You want 2 entire bulbs of those bad boys. Separate them cloves, don't bother peeling them, and put 'em on a baking sheet drizzled with oil. Put them in the oven. Completely disregard the fact that the oven should be at 375 degs F and you should leave them in there for 15 mins.

3) Dice up an onion and cook it in some oil with a spoonful of dried thyme. At this point everything smells delicious and you have already succeeded. Cook the onion until it is soft.

4) Oh crap also cut up that chili and throw it in with the onion. Do this before the onion is soft.

5) Cut the potatoes into bite size pieces.

I think according to my lovely book (THAT I LOVE) you are supposed to peel them first, because there's no way to get a soup as white as the one in their picture with peel in it. But you're not gonna do that, because you're not RACIST and you know that BROWN SOUPS are just as delicious as WHITE ONES. If not more so.

BAM you came for the recipes, you stayed for the social commentary.

Also you know the peel is basically the only nutritious part of the potato, so yeah.

ANYWAY, /tangent, put them potatoes in with the onion and cook 'em for a while, stirring.

6) Pour in your 5 cups of stock. If you don't have any, and are too cheap or lazy to buy/make some, use some water and boullion. I won't tell. :3

Boil this for a while. Like, 10 mins or something?

7) Now squeeze in the...where's the garlic?

Nvm, take the garlic out of the oven and...

...and marvel at the unusable charred remains of 2 bulbs of garlic.

8) Sob hysterically.

9) Go here for ideas of what to do now.

10) IF YOU FAILED TO FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS and did not disregard the oven parameters, you are punished by having to squeeze the soft garlic cloves out of their skins into the soup. It smells nutty and delicious, and very different from the garlic you know. It adds a depth of flavor to the soup that you did not know could be acheived with such a simple ingredient.

This is what you get for not following instructions.

10) Boil it all until the potatoes are fork tender.

11) Use your blender (WHICH YOU ALSO LOVE) to blend the soup in batches. Resist the urge to "taste" a big spoonful of each batch. Fail to resist this urge.

12) Bring everything back to the pot and add about a cup of cream. Half and half, heavy cream, whipping cream, evaporated milk, whatever's around.

13) Bring everything back to your pot, heat everything up again, and stir until the cream's all mixed in. If you serve it with a swirl of cream and some thyme sprinkled on top, people will lose their shit.

Even if you serve it in a big tan mug-bowl from goodwill :]

Permalink | Leave a comment  »

item.title: PARISIAN CATHEDRAL 40 DAY LENT CHALLENGE: II
item.description:
Part II: La Madeleine

This big beauty doesn't LOOK like a church, but mostly because it was built to be a government building. Then some stuff happened and I guess they made it into a church?

See the full gallery on Posterous

Chopin's funeral was held here.

What a badass.

Also: decently dressed?? Screw you, my tshirt and jeans and ratty shoes are good enough for you

The inside was AMAZING

(here, have another awkwardly stitched together picture with a skewed perspective)

And I thought the LAST one had fancy chandeliers

VICTORY =D

Gnight, Folks.

item.title: Beautiful Moments
item.description:
Watching a beautiful movie, drinking rose green tea, and watching the snow dance outside  your window makes for an amazing quiet saturday, but sure can make you wish someone else were around to appreciate it too.

On an unrelated note, apparently here, when supermarkets want you to buy their potatoes, they give free samples, like in the US. But first they cover them in some deliciously fatty dressing and top them with flipping caviar.

Okay maybe that's not really caviar (is caviar allowed to be red?) but still. WTF Paris.

 

PS Watch "Pariah".

Permalink | Leave a comment  »

item.title: Exploring?
item.description:
3 months is quite some time, but maybe not enough to know every nook and cranny of your room

Have you ever misplaced a shoe and looked for it in the fridge or somewhere it couldn't possibly be, because, I dunno, maybe some elves took it and shoved it in there?

Maybe my dish soap is up here

Wait WTF is that

WHO LEFT THIS HERE?

WHY IS THERE A ROLL OF TOILET PAPER HIDDEN IN MY ROOM

AND WHY IS IT SO FANCY?!

I didn't know what to do so I put it back and pretended like nothing ever happened :(

...except now I KNOW. It's THERE. 

Permalink | Leave a comment  »

item.title: PARISIAN CATHEDRAL 40 DAY LENT CHALLENGE
item.description:
For Lent I'm doing a Parisian Cathedral 40 day Lent Challenge! =D

or PC40 for short =)

Every Sunday I'll be hitting up a different cathedral in Paris and taking pictures, hoping they don't all look the same!

Today I went to The Saint Germain l'Auxerrois! TWAS PURDY.

Purdy orb chandeliers!

Although, I was 30 minutes late to the mass =( Not the best way to start the Parisian Cathedral 40 day Lent Challenge =/

Oh well, next time I'll do better! =)

Permalink | Leave a comment  »

item.title: Eggstensive Measures.
item.description:
What to you do when Chinese New Years comes and goes and the kind people who made the food are about to throw away their big bowl of whisked egg?

You save it, of course, and promise people you'll be making omelettes tomorrow morning.

What happens when only two people come?

You improvise and do something better with the rest of the egg.

These were SO GOOD they were SO MUCH BETTER THAN THEY LOOK.

Of course, unlike the omelettes, I had to use a few things of my own to make these.

But that's okay.

After all,

item.title: Projects.
item.description:
This phase I'm going through.

Where everything seems to sound like a good idea and I'm taking up projects left and right.

This needs to stop.

This is how you end up agreeing to wake up at 7 the next morning and cook omelettes for 5 people -_______-

(at no cost to yourself, of course. You may have gone crazy, but you're still on a budget.)

item.title: ARGH MY LEGS.
item.description:
The story of why my legs hurt is simple and can probably be told in a sentence.

But that's not we're about here at Chase the Wind. So we're gonna go through this story with unnecessary detail and multiple tangents, and pictures.

and backwards.

1) So I just finished printing out a CAF form, which is part of a process that, if successful, will result in my rent getting subsidized about 100 euro a month. SCORE.

Printing a form. Sounds easy, no?

Well, I'm an ISFJ, and for all my IJ's out there, I want to express how a simple task suddenly becomes an ordeal when you're in a new setting.

The fact that my friend gave me instructions on where to go and what to do made it pretty manageable, but also gave the feeling that I was on a James Bond mission -_____-

 

0) Yoga and Soy Earl Gray Sunday: it's becoming a tradition? They are such a beautiful mix, I still feel the need to tell the internet that I did them and they were both fun and delicious.

Also: yoga is part of the reason my legs hurt.

 

-1) I FOUND MY HAND-USE DOPPLEGANGER. My friend SK is the only person who has the exact same hand use as me! You can join us and we can start a club if you:

Write with your left hand

Eat with your left hand

Use scissors with your right hand

Play sports right-handedly

Use either hand to brush your teeth.

 

-2) Afterwards, we went to drink hot chocolate in one o' them PARISIAN CAFES.

Livin the dream =]

(except I can never go back because I tried to pull out the reciept from the hand-held card reader this guy handed me, but it popped open and the whole roll of paper fell out. Smooth, David.)

 

-3)  We went ice skating at the Hotel de Ville! =D 'twas a wonderful time! =]

See the full gallery on Posterous

Also: with the magic of imagestitch technology, THIS exists =D

Also: ice skating is hard and afterwards my legs hurt even more D=

 

-4) Sh-Sh-Sh-SHOPPING! Mostly groceries, but I bought a LOT of food :I whooops.

It got so heavy so fast, and by the time I got back my legs started to hurt =/

BUT BUT BUT The big annual French Soldes are going, and I bought myself a thing.

THIS...THIS MAY HAVE NOT BEEN THE BEST DECISION.

See the full gallery on Posterous

JUST KIDDING this is without a doubt the BEST decision.

Guys it was TEN EURO, what was I supposed to do, not buy it??

 

I hope you all are having a wonderful weekend =] Much love!

 

Permalink | Leave a comment  »
